text:
KATE Middleton has glowed in glorious yellow as she and Prince William joined a star-studded crowd to watch the Wimbledon men’s final on Sunday.

The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge watched from the Royal Box as Novak Djokovic beat out Kevin Anderson in straight sets.

The 36-year-old Duchess looked striking in a yellow Dolce & Gabbana midi dress with ruffle sleeve detail, the outfit completed with a sweet blue bow. The dress was similar to the Brandon Maxwell dress her sister-in-law, Meghan Markle, wore at an event in London last week.

Kate, who is the patron of the All England Lawn Tennis & Croquet Club, seemed keen on catching all the action — staring intently at the court as Novak stormed to his fourth Wimbledon title.

Leaving kids George, Charlotte and Louis at home, Kate and William, 36, appeared to be enjoying their afternoon out together for the game.

This afternoon’s match brought out all the big names, including Prime Minister Theresa May, and actors Benedict Cumberbatch, Eddie Redmayne and Emma Watson.

The stars all seemed eager to chat as they sat in the prestigious box — with Sherlock star Cumberbatch spotted sharing a joke with Redmayne.

Hugh Grant also made an appearance, along with Spiderman’s Tom Holland.

The Sunday afternoon match also saw Prime Minister Theresa May appearing relaxed, despite having had a big week that included meeting with US President Donald Trump. The politician didn’t seem to mind as she stood to give room for Kate and William to squeeze past to their seats ahead of the game.

It comes after mum-of-three Kate was joined by sister-in-law Meghan for the women’s singles final on Saturday.

The Duchesses exuded Wimbledon chic with Meghan, 36, teaming a loose-fitted blue and white-striped shirt with wide-legged, high-waisted white trousers and a white straw boater hat.

Meanwhile, Kate sported a black and white patterned midi dress with ruffle detail, teamed with nude heels and drop earrings.

The pair appeared to get along smashingly — exchanging jokes and smiles as they watched Serena Williams lose in straight sets to Germany’s Angelique Kerber.

Meghan appeared disheartened after Serena lost the match, with the athlete telling fellow mums: “I was playing for you today.”

The top tennis player gave birth to her first child in September last year — returning to her beloved sport in less than a year.

Meghan and Kate managed to stay cool during the match, shown around Wimbledon by chairman of the AELTC Philip Brook and his wife Gill.

They then greeted an excited line of ball boys and ball girls at the club and chatted to some junior tennis players.

This article originally appeared on The Sun and has been republished with permission.
title: Kate Middleton, Prince William: Duchess stuns in yellow at Wimbledon
